result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher M McClain

records.addlTxt:
10:44 AM Defendant Christopher M McClain in court with attorney Adrian W Longacre.  Defendant Christopher M McClain in custody.  scott H dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher M McClain appeared by video means with Attorney.  Heard along with 2018CF141, 2020CT32, 21CM28, 22CM20.  Agreement reached in all cases.  State recites agreement into the court record.  No corrections or additions to revocation packet from either party.  State is compliance with all victim notifications.  2018CF141-Recommended sentence will be for 12 months jail.  Argument entered by each side.  Court will accept the recommended sentence.  DE has credit for 166 days served.  DE will have huber privilege in this case.  Ms Abel makes a statement to the court. 

21CM28- DE will enter a plea to amended Ct 2, recommended sentence is for 6 months jail, concurrent with 2018CF141.  55 days credit.    Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily made, court accepts plea of NC,  finds DE guilty.  Sentencing argument entered by parties.  The court will accept the recommended sentence, will order 6 months jail concurrent with 2018CF141 sentence.  DE will pay CC, provide DNA/pay surcharge.  DE will have huber for employment and family care.   Adj 11:16AM. 

20CT32, 21CM28 CT 1 and 22CM20 will be DRI.
Initial appearance on February 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
COS of Summons/Complaint served to Christopher Mcclain bu Deputy M Egle
